DOC.brief_summary: Aims study : This double-blind randomized-controlled trial test effect task orient training combine cerebellar transcranial direct current stimulation locomotor function , mobility balance multiple sclerosis subject moderate gait impairment ( EDSS 4-5,5 ) . Subjects method : 30 multiple sclerosis patient recruit outpatient rehabilitation clinic University Hospital Ferrara . Informed consent obtain . Participants enrol include 2 different treatment group : Task Oriented Circuit Training ( TOCT ) + anodal cerebellar transcranial direct current stimulation ( experimental group ) TOCT + sham transcranial direct current stimulation cerebellum ( control group ) . The group anodal transcranial direct current stimulation receive continuous stimulation intensity 2 mA first 15 minute functional circuit training . In sham session , anodal transcranial direct current stimulation apply 30 shut . Each subject receive 10 task-oriented training session 2 week ( 5 sessions/week ) . 3 subject supervisor physiotherapist take part TOCT . During stimulation session subject researcher , responsible carry clinical test , unaware type stimulation set . Treatment efficacy outcome measure clinical test gait speed ( Timed 25-Foot Walk ) , walk endurance ( six minute walk test ) , balance ( Dynamic Gait Index ) mobility ( Time Up Go Test ) ; self-assessment questionnaire motor fatigue ( Fatigue Severity Scale FSS ) quality life ( Short Form ( 36 ) Health Survey ) . Outcome measure assess week prior treatment initiation ( T0 ) , week end treatment ( T1 ) 3 month follow-up ( T3 ) evaluate treatment retention , clinician blind treatment . At end session , subject complete questionnaire report side effect due stimulation ( headache , neck pain , burning , redness and/or itch site stimulation ) .
